item.title: Danny add a quote by William Alexander
item.description: "Earth teach me to forget myself as melted snow forgets its life. Earth teach me resignation as the leaves which die in the fall. Earth teach me courage as the tree which stands all alone. Earth teach me regeneration as the seed which rises in the spring." -- William Alexander

item.title: Danny add a quote by Lily Tomlin
item.description: "The road to success is always under construction" -- Lily Tomlin

item.title: Danny add a quote by Henry Miller
item.description: "If we are always arriving and departing, it is also true that we are eternally anchored. One's destination is never a place but rather a new way of looking at things." -- Henry Miller

item.title: Danny add a quote by Francois Duc de la Rochefoucauld
item.description: "Absence diminishes small loves and increases great ones, as the wind blows out the candle and fans the bonfire." -- Francois Duc de la Rochefoucauld

item.title: Danny add a quote by Harriet Beecher Stowe
item.description: "When you get into a tight place and everything goes against you until it seems that you cannot hold on for a minute longer, never give up then, for that is just the place and time when the tide will turn." -- Harriet Beecher Stowe

item.title: Danny add a quote by H. Jackson Brown Jr.
item.description: "Twenty years from now you will be more disappointed by the things that you didn't do than by the ones you did do. So throw off the bowlines. Sail away from the safe harbor. Catch the trade winds in your sails. Explore. Dream. Discover." -- H. Jackson Brown Jr.

item.title: Danny add a quote by Colin Powell
item.description: "The freedom to do your best means nothing unless you are willing to do your best." -- Colin Powell

item.title: Danny add a quote by Patrick Overton
item.description: "When you walk to the edge of all the light you have and take that first step into the darkness of the unknown, you must believe that one of two things will happen. There will be something solid for you to stand upon or you will be taught to fly." -- Patrick Overton

item.title: Danny add a quote by Mother Teresa
item.description: "Not all of us can do great things. But we can do small things with great love." -- Mother Teresa

item.title: Danny add a quote by Soren Kierkegaard
item.description: "The function of prayer is not to influence God, but rather to change the nature of the one who prays." -- Soren Kierkegaard

item.title: Danny add a quote by Martin Tupper
item.description: "Well-timed silence hath more eloquence than speech." -- Martin Tupper

item.title: Danny add a quote by Kahlil Gibran
item.description: "For what is it to die but to stand naked in the wind and to melt into the sun? And when the earth shall claim your limbs, then shall you truly dance." -- Kahlil Gibran

item.title: Danny add a quote by Matsuo Basho
item.description: "Do not seek to follow in the footsteps of the wise; seek what they sought." -- Matsuo Basho

item.title: Danny add a quote by Lily Tomlin
item.description: "When I was growing up I always wanted to be someone. Now I realize I should have been more specific." -- Lily Tomlin

item.title: Danny add a quote by Zig Ziglar
item.description: "Of course motivation is not permanent. But then, neither is bathing; but it is something you should do on a regular basis." -- Zig Ziglar

item.title: Danny add a quote by Kahlil Gibran
item.description: "Tenderness and kindness are not signs of weakness and despair, but manifestations of strength and resolution." -- Kahlil Gibran

item.title: Danny add a quote by William Penn
item.description: "I expect to pass through life but once. If therefore there be any kindness I can show...let me do it now." -- William Penn

item.title: Danny add a quote by Edward Everett Hale
item.description: "I am only one, but still I am one. I cannot do everything, but still I can do something; and because I cannot do everything, I will not refuse to do something that I can do." -- Edward Everett Hale

item.title: Danny add a quote by Margaret Mead
item.description: "Never doubt that a small group of thoughtful, committed, citizens can change the world. Indeed, it is the only thing that ever has." -- Margaret Mead

item.title: Danny add a quote by Nelson Mandela
item.description: "After climbing a great hill, one only finds that there are many more hills to climb." -- Nelson Mandela

item.title: Danny add a quote by Shirley MacLaine
item.description: "Fear makes strangers of people who would be friends." -- Shirley MacLaine

item.title: Danny add a quote by Jay Leno
item.description: "With hurricanes, tornados, fires out of control, mud slides, flooding, severe thunderstorms tearing up the country from one end to another, and with the threat of bird flu and terrorist attacks, "Are we sure this is a good time to take God out of the Pledge of Allegiance?" -- Jay Leno

item.title: Danny add a quote by Mahatma Gandhi
item.description: "The difference between what we do and what we are capable of doing would suffice to solve most of the world's problems." -- Mahatma Gandhi

item.title: Danny add a quote by Abraham Lincoln
item.description: "Character is like a tree and reputation its shadow. The shadow is what we think it is and the tree is the real thing." -- Abraham Lincoln

item.title: Danny add a quote by Bill Wilson
item.description: "Indecision with the passing of time becomes decision." -- Bill Wilson

item.title: Danny add a quote by Dalai Lama XIV
item.description: "Judge your success by what you had to give up in order to get it." -- Dalai Lama XIV

item.title: Danny add a quote by Diogenes
item.description: "Time is the most valuable thing that a man can spend." -- Diogenes

item.title: Danny add a quote by Mark Twain
item.description: "The man who does not read has no advantage over the man who cannot read." -- Mark Twain

item.title: Danny add a quote by Charles Buxton
item.description: "You will never find time for anything. If you want time, you must make it." -- Charles Buxton

item.title: Danny add a quote by Albert Einstein
item.description: "Great spirits have always encountered violent opposition from mediocre minds." -- Albert Einstein
